TEXT: The applicant is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He is represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a member of the Conseil d’État and ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

In DATE the applicant and ORG formed a public company , PERSON , whose registered office was in GPE . On DATE the company , which was already in financial difficulty , borrowed MONEY ( FRF ) from GPE , ORG ’s nephew . Under the terms of an agreement made on DATE between the applicant , ORG and GPE , ORG undertook to reimburse his nephew the sum of ORG CARDINAL owed by the company . The applicant undertook to guarantee ORG the reimbursement of that same amount “ that PERSON will owe him once [ ORG ] has paid that company ’s debt to [ FAC ] ” .

As PERSON was unable to repay ORG , the applicant paid him a total of ORG CARDINAL pursuant to his undertaking . On DATE ORG made an order for the judicial reorganisation of the company . That order was followed by an order for its liquidation on DATE . As ORG had failed to lodge a proof of his debt with the representative of the creditors of the company , the applicant considered it to be extinguished pursuant to section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the PERSON of DATE , which meant that his own obligation as guarantor of the company ’s debt to ORG was likewise extinguished . He therefore did not pay ORG the balance of ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL of debt that had been extinguished . Subsequently , considering himself ruined , he left GPE and returned to GPE .
On DATE ORG brought an action against the applicant in ORG for payment of the sum of ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL together with statutory interest , damages , expenses and legal costs .
On DATE the applicant brought a counterclaim against ORG for rescission of the agreement of DATE and restitution of the sum of ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL he had already paid .

In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG ordered the applicant to pay ORG the sum claimed plus interest , making a total of over FRF CARDINAL . The judgment was upheld by ORG on DATE , which held , in particular , that the applicant ’s undertaking amounted not to an ordinary guarantee that had been extinguished with the primary debt , but as a first - call guarantee that remained in place despite the extinguishment of the primary debt .
On DATE the applicant appealed against that decision to ORG . On DATE he lodged written submissions in which he argued that his undertaking should be classified as an ordinary guarantee .
On DATE P.B. made an application to the President of ORG under Article CARDINAL - CARDINAL of LAW for an order removing the appeal from the list for failure to comply with the impugned decision .
That application was granted by an order of DATE removing the appeal from the list of cases pending before ORG . The order stated :
“ Although he has not complied with the orders made in the judgment , [ the applicant ] seeks to oppose an order being made pursuant to the provisions of Article CARDINAL - CARDINAL of LAW ...

In the instant case , [ the applicant ] has failed to show that he has taken any steps apt to demonstrate his intention to comply with the decision of the courts below and has not pleaded any personal circumstances that give rise to a danger or presumption that compliance will entail manifestly unreasonable consequences . ”

No sums were paid under the judgment within the time - limit of DATE from the date of that order . On DATE the applicant sought a declaration that the appeal had lapsed . On DATE the President of ORG made a declaration that the appeal had lapsed pursuant to LAW .
“ Proceedings shall lapse if none of the parties take any steps for DATE . ”

“ Except in cases in which an appeal on points of law acts as a bar to execution of the impugned decision , the President may , on application by the respondent and after obtaining the opinion of ORG and the parties , order the removal of the case from the list if the appellant fails to show that he or she has to comply with the impugned decision , or unless it appears to the President that execution may entail manifestly unreasonable consequences .
The President shall grant permission for the case to be restored to the list on proof of compliance with the impugned decision . ”
